alert.note: Alert for Blair (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 6:35PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Blair. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Radar rainfall estimates of 1.5 to 2 inches have been noted since about 530 pm. Additional rainfall of 0.75 to 1.5 inches is possible through about 730 pm. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Altoona, Hollidaysburg, Lakemont, Duncansville, East Freedom, Newry, Lakemont Park And Island Waterpark and Peoples Natural Gas Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
